intro: Biscutella valentina var. tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaved biscutella, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of hairs. It is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing a range of drought-resistant botanical traits.
